metroflex_events.overview: MetroFlex hosts three premier NPC Championship events: Better Bodies Classic (rebranded as Texas Legends Championship), Ronnie Coleman Classic 30th Anniversary, and Branch Warren Classic Houston. All events use MuscleWare registration platform.

events.name: Texas Legends Championship
events.location: The Original MetroFlex Gym, Arlington, TX
events.description: Experience the raw intensity of powerlifting combined with MetroFlex's legendary Wild Game Feast. Witness elite strength athletes compete in the atmosphere that forged champions for over 38 years.

events.name: NPC Ronnie Coleman Classic
events.location: Fort Worth Convention Center, Fort Worth, TX
events.description: Celebrating 30 years of the Ronnie Coleman Classic. Championship NPC bodybuilding event honoring 8x Mr. Olympia Ronnie Coleman. One of Texas' premier national qualifier events.

events.name: NPC Branch Warren Classic Houston
events.description: Texas' flagship Branch Warren Classic. Championship NPC bodybuilding event honoring 2x Arnold Classic Champion Branch Warren. National qualifier status.
special_features: Honoring 2x Arnold Classic Champion Branch Warren

muscleware_platform.overview: MuscleWare is the official contest software and registration platform for NPC, NPC Worldwide, IFBB Professional League, and Canadian Physique Alliance.
muscleware_platform.key_principle: Athletes DO NOT register directly on MuscleWare.com. Instead, each event promoter has a dedicated event website where registration occurs. MuscleWare powers the backend.

registration_process.action: Find your contest at npcnewsonline.com contest calendar
Complete personal information (name, DOB, email, phone, country)
Enter valid NPC Member Number (must be non-zero)
Select division(s) and class(es) - up to 8 divisions per registration
Accept Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy
Proceed to Confirmation and review information
Complete payment through promoter's payment gateway
Receive confirmation email with athlete profile link

common_questions.question: Do I need an NPC membership to compete?
common_questions.answer: Yes, you must have a valid NPC Member Number to register for any NPC competition. Visit npcnewsonline.com to purchase membership if you don't have one.

common_questions.question: Can I compete in multiple divisions?
common_questions.answer: Yes, you can compete in up to 8 divisions per registration. However, Women's Fit Model competitors cannot cross over to other divisions.

common_questions.question: How do I know which class to choose?
common_questions.answer: Classes are determined by weight, height, age, or experience level depending on the division. Review the complete class structures for your division. If unsure, contact the event promoter.

common_questions.question: What's the difference between Novice and True Novice?
common_questions.answer: True Novice means you have never competed before in any division. Novice means you haven't won an overall or class in that specific division.

common_questions.question: When should I upload my posing music?
common_questions.answer: Upload music to your Athlete Profile page (link in confirmation email) typically 48-72 hours before the event. MP3 format only.

common_questions.question: What if I need to change my class after registration?
common_questions.answer: Contact the event promoter directly through the contact information provided in your confirmation email.

common_questions.question: How does Classic Physique weight limits work?
common_questions.answer: Classic Physique uses a height-to-weight ratio formula. Your maximum allowable weight is determined by your height. Check the official NPC rules for specific weight caps per height.

common_questions.question: What payment methods are accepted?
common_questions.answer: Payment methods vary by promoter and typically include PayPal, Stripe, Square, Razorpay, Yoco, or FirstData. Funds flow directly to the event promoter.

common_questions.question: Will I receive a confirmation?
common_questions.answer: Yes, you'll receive a professional confirmation email containing registration details, your Athlete Profile link, music upload instructions, and event-specific information.

common_questions.question: Can I register on the day of the show?
common_questions.answer: Some events allow day-of-show registration at the highest pricing tier, but availability varies by promoter. Early registration is strongly recommended.

troubleshooting.solution: Ensure both email fields match exactly, including capitalization. Check for extra spaces.
NPC Member Number must be non-zero. If you don't have one, visit npcnewsonline.com to purchase membership first.
You can select up to 8 divisions. Each division requires a corresponding class selection. Ensure you're not trying to register for the same class twice.
Ensure file is MP3 format only. Check file size isn't too large. Use your Athlete Profile link from confirmation email to upload.
Payment processing uses the promoter's selected gateway. Contact the event promoter directly if payment issues occur.
Check spam folder. Wait 15-30 minutes. Contact event promoter if still not received.
